author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Delaware County in a flood watch. How much rain is likely?
text: Batten down the hatches again, Delaware County, there’s only a flood watch out for now, but the next wave of rain threatens to be a doozy with warnings aplenty probably ahead. The National Weather Service office in Mount Holly, New Jersey, has issued a flood watch from Saturday at 4 a.m. to Sunday at 8 a.m. It reads, in part: “Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
